title.narrative: Developing Cleaner Export Pathways for Agriculture

description.narrative: Fiji is currently the main exporter of taro to Australia and New Zealand, and other Pacific Island countries (PICs) also export small amounts. Samoa is rebuilding its taro production base following the development and introduction of varieties resistant to taro leaf blight (TLB). However, the opportunity to improve rural livelihoods through taro exports is being hindered by poor quality consignments, including some contaminated with pests of quarantine concern detected on arrival at export destinations. The aim of this project is to restore the viability of export pathways for taro. Specific objectives are to: improve the sustainability of the taro supply chain; evaluate hot water dipping as a phytosanitary treatment against nematodes and mites; and ensure coordination of research and dissemination of outputs (in the context of multiple efforts to improve taro production, supply and market access.
